intro: Cedrela pilgeri, commonly known as the yellow cedar or white cedar, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically followed by woody capsules containing seeds.
